The pipe is partially blocked, allowing water to drain out the other end of the pipe at a rate modeled by  <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi> D </mi> <mrow> <mo> ( </mo> <mi> t </mi> <mo> ) </mo> </mrow> <mo> = </mo> <mo> − </mo> <mn> 0.04 </mn> <msup> <mi> t </mi> <mn> 3 </mn> </msup> <mo> + </mo> <mn> 0.4 </mn> <msup> <mi> t </mi> <mn> 2 </mn> </msup> <mo> + </mo> <mn> 0.96 </mn> <mi> t </mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF"> MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaaeaaaaaaaaa8 qacaWGebWaaeWaa8aabaWdbiaadshaaiaawIcacaGLPaaacqGH9aqp cqGHsislcaaIWaGaaiOlaiaaicdacaaI0aGaamiDa8aadaahaaWcbe qaa8qacaaIZaaaaOGaey4kaSIaaGimaiaac6cacaaI0aGaamiDa8aa daahaaWcbeqaa8qacaaIYaaaaOGaey4kaSIaaGimaiaac6cacaaI5a GaaGOnaiaadshaaaa@4A44@ </annotation> </semantics> </math>  cubic feet per hour, for 0 ≤ t ≤ 8. There are 30 cubic feet of water in the pipe at time t  = 0.

(a) How many cubic feet of rainwater flow into the pipe during the 8-hour time interval <math style="font-family: inherit; font-size: inherit; font-variant-ligatures: inherit; font-variant-caps: inherit; font-weight: inherit;"> <mrow style=""> <mn style="font-style: inherit;"> 0  </mn> <mo style="font-style: inherit;"> ≤  </mo> <mi style=""> t  </mi> <mo style="font-style: inherit;"> ≤  </mo> <mn style="font-style: inherit;"> 8 </mn> </mrow> </math> ?

The rate at which rainwater flows into a drainpipe is modeled by the function R , where  <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi> R </mi> <mrow> <mo> ( </mo> <mi> t </mi> <mo> ) </mo> </mrow> <mo> = </mo> <mn> 20 </mn> <mi> sin </mi> <mrow> <mo> ( </mo> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <msup> <mi> t </mi> <mn> 2 </mn> </msup> </mrow> <mrow> <mn> 35 </mn> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> <mo> ) </mo> </mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF"> MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaaeaaaaaaaaa8 qacaWGsbWaaeWaa8aabaWdbiaadshaaiaawIcacaGLPaaacqGH9aqp caaIYaGaaGimaiGacohacaGGPbGaaiOBamaabmaapaqaa8qadaWcaa WdaeaapeGaamiDa8aadaahaaWcbeqaa8qacaaIYaaaaaGcpaqaa8qa caaIZaGaaGynaaaaaiaawIcacaGLPaaaaaa@445F@ </annotation> </semantics> </math> cubic feet per hour, t is measured in hours, and 0 ≤ t  ≤ 8. The pipe is partially blocked, allowing water to drain out the other end of the pipe at a rate modeled by  <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi> D </mi> <mrow> <mo> ( </mo> <mi> t </mi> <mo> ) </mo> </mrow> <mo> = </mo> <mo> − </mo> <mn> 0.04 </mn> <msup> <mi> t </mi> <mn> 3 </mn> </msup> <mo> + </mo> <mn> 0.4 </mn> <msup> <mi> t </mi> <mn> 2 </mn> </msup> <mo> + </mo> <mn> 0.96 </mn> <mi> t </mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF"> MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaaeaaaaaaaaa8 qacaWGebWaaeWaa8aabaWdbiaadshaaiaawIcacaGLPaaacqGH9aqp cqGHsislcaaIWaGaaiOlaiaaicdacaaI0aGaamiDa8aadaahaaWcbe qaa8qacaaIZaaaaOGaey4kaSIaaGimaiaac6cacaaI0aGaamiDa8aa daahaaWcbeqaa8qacaaIYaaaaOGaey4kaSIaaGimaiaac6cacaaI5a GaaGOnaiaadshaaaa@4A44@ </annotation> </semantics> </math>  cubic feet per hour, for 0 ≤ t ≤ 8. There are 30 cubic feet of water in the pipe at time t  = 0.

(a) How many cubic feet of rainwater flow into the pipe during the 8-hour time interval <math style="font-family: inherit; font-size: inherit; font-variant-ligatures: inherit; font-variant-caps: inherit; font-weight: inherit;"> <mrow style=""> <mn style="font-style: inherit;"> 0  </mn> <mo style="font-style: inherit;"> ≤  </mo> <mi style=""> t  </mi> <mo style="font-style: inherit;"> ≤  </mo> <mn style="font-style: inherit;"> 8 </mn> </mrow> </math> ?
(b) Is the amount of water in the pipe increasing or decreasing at time t = 3 hours? Give a reason for your answer.
(c) At what time t, 0 ≤ t ≤ 8, is the amount of water in the pipe at a minimum? Justify your answer.

(d) The pipe can hold 50 cubic feet of water before overflowing. For t > 8, water continues to flow into and out of the pipe at the given rates until the pipe begins to overflow. Write, but do not solve, an equation involving one or more integrals that gives the time w when the pipe will begin to overflow.

topic.text: 5.3: Determining Intervals on Which a Function Is Increasing or Decreasing

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
